content.question: A cylindrical capacitor of length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> is made up of a conducting cylindrical shell of radius <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math> concentric with a conducting solid cylinder of radius <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>. The linear charge density of the inner conductor is <math alttext="lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>λ</mi></mstyle></math> and that of the outer conductor is <math alttext="negative lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>−</mo><mi>λ</mi></math>. Which of the following gives a correct expression for the capacitance of this capacitor?

choices.label: <math alttext="C equals the fraction with numerator 2 times pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times L, and denominator, the natural log of, the fraction b over a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="C equals pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times the fraction with numerator a b L, and denominator, b minus a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mfrac><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="C equals 2 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times the fraction with numerator b L, and denominator, b minus a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mfrac><mrow><mi>b</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="C equals 4 pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times the fraction with numerator a b, and denominator, b minus a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mfrac><mrow><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="C equals the fraction with numerator 2 times pi epsilon sub 0, end sub, times L, and denominator, the natural log of, the fraction b over a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
